title: After getting two successive discounts Deepa got a shirt at Rs. 136 whose marked price is Rs. 200. If the second discount is 15% what will be the first discount? - Quora

response.answer_text: 20% This problem can be done in mind in few seconds. However, our rote learning mind will not allow us and we take many steps. Once we read second discount, our mind keeps the first discount as ‘x’. Just change your mind and keep the second discount as ‘x’. It becomes easier. The effect is the same. 200–30=170–136=34 is 20% of 170.
Let the first discount be= D%, then,200 x (100 - D)/100 x (100–15)/100= 136So(100- D)=136 x 100/85 x 100/200 = 80Therefore D= 20.Therefore the first discount was 20% .

Let the the price after first discount be X So X * 85% = 136 X = 136/85% = 160 160 is the price after the first discount. 200 is the original discount. Discount given in the first instance is 40. Discount percentage is 40/200 = 20% First discount is 20% on 200.

Market price = Rs 200 Let first discount be ‘x’%. So price after first discount =Rs (200–2x) Price after second discount of 15% = Rs((200–2x) - 0.15(200–2x))= 170–1.7x So 170 - 1.7x = 136 >>> x=20 So the first discount was 20 %

Total discount=rs(200–136) =64 % Discount=6400/200=32% Let first discount be =a% Hence: a+15-a×15/100=32 a+15–3a/20=32 (20a+300–3a) /20=32 17a+300=32×20 17a=640–300=340 a=340/17=20 First discount =20% … Answer
Suppose cost price = 100 So sell price = 85 which is ₹ 136 So cost price = 100/85 × 136 = 160 Now tag price = 200 & sell price is 160 So discount% = 40/200 × 100 = 20%
Total discount = 200 - 136 = 64 rs 1st discount = 2x 2nd discount = 0.15*(200 - 2x) = 30 - 0.3x 2x + 30 - 0.3x = 64 1.7x = 34 x = 20%
20%….FIRST GETTING 40 RS ON 200 RS LABELLED PRICE IT BECAME 160 AND NEXT GETTING 15 % ON IT MAKES 136
